Pre-Game Insights: England has only two points from four games, while Sri Lanka has also only two points.
England's batting has misfired, with just one century and four fifties so far.
Sri Lanka's attack conceded scores of 428 for 5 and 345 for 4 in their opening games.
England's captain, Jos Buttler, has scored just 87 runs in four innings.
Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis has been the standout batsman, scoring 76 and 101 in their first two games.
Chris Silverwood, England's head coach, coached Sri Lanka in the previous World Cup and will face them for the second time.
England may consider bringing Brydon Carse to the team as a battering ram in the middle overs.
Sri Lanka has been granted permission to bring in Angelo Mathews as a replacement for Matheesha Pathirana.
The M Chinnaswamy Stadium has a reputation for high-scoring games, with 672 runs scored in the previous ODI there.
England has won eight out of eleven ODIs between the sides since 2015, with one tie.
Sri Lanka has won each of the last four meetings, including a shocking 2019 result that jeopardized England's home World Cup hopes.
